page.title:
Contaminated Halon
Contaminated Halon
page.normal_text:
Background
Background
page.enlisting:
UK based company delivered polluted Halon (H1211 / H1301) 17 Customers identified EASA / CAA UK approach individually each company involved in Aviation either as PartM /Part145 Wide variety of applications: handheld, enigne, APU, cargo for General aviation, Helicopters & Large airplanes
UK based company delivered polluted Halon
(H1211 / H1301)
17 Customers identified
EASA / CAA UK approach individually each
company involved in Aviation either as
PartM /Part145
Wide variety of applications: handheld,
enigne, APU, cargo for General aviation,
Helicopters & Large airplanes

page.title:
Contaminated Halon 1211
Contaminated Halon 1211
page.normal_text:
EASA global approach for Halon 1211
EASA global approach for Halon 1211
page.enlisting:
Identification of the suspected batches Test of the suspected batches According to the results (purity <90%) issuance of AD with defined applicability (P/N, S/N) For all batches with 90%<purity <99% FAA-TC Tests done with different levels of contaminants to determine compliance time for future ADs
Identification of the suspected batches
Test of the suspected batches
According to the results (purity <90%)
issuance of AD with defined applicability
(P/N, S/N)
For all batches with 90%<purity <99%
FAA-TC Tests done with different levels of
contaminants to determine compliance time
for future ADs

Level of risk is still under assessment taking into account:

taking into account:

Less toxicity impact for engines and APU

Purity % vs Fire suppression capability o be assessed on a case-by-case basis

be assessed on a case-by-case basis

page.title:
Contaminated Halon/ICAO state letter
Contaminated Halon/ICAO
state letter
page.normal_text:
ICAO state letter was released on 12th of January 2010
ICAO state letter was released on 12th of
January 2010

This letter does not formally require answer
This letter does not formally require answer

It requires Member States « to assess halon fire extinguishing supplies and take action as appropriate »
It requires Member States « to assess halon
fire extinguishing supplies and take action
as appropriate »

Based on this letter, the strategy chosen by the Agency in cooperation with the EC is the following :
Based on this letter, the strategy chosen by
the Agency in cooperation with the EC is the
following :

IASFPWG - 18-19 May 2010 - London

page.normal_text:
European Aviation Safety Agency
European Aviation Safety Agency E u r o p e a n
A v i a t i o n
S a f e t y A g e n c y
page.title:
Contaminated Halon/ICAO state letter / EASA position
Contaminated Halon/ICAO
state letter / EASA position
page.normal_text:
As a short term action
As a short term action

The Agency has already issued an SIB to raise awareness of Air operators, AMOs, aviation suppliers and manufacturers . The SIB will be up-dated.
The Agency has already issued an SIB to
raise awareness of Air operators, AMOs,
aviation suppliers and manufacturers .
The SIB will be up-dated.

As a mid/long term action
As a mid/long term action

Based on the recent events of falsified documents, reliance on documentation to ensure quality of halon is not enough
Based on the recent events of falsified
documents, reliance on documentation to
ensure quality of halon is not enough

page.title:
Contaminated Halon/ICAO state letter
Contaminated Halon/ICAO
state letter
page.normal_text:
The answer to the State letter is under drafting at the Agency/EC and will be released by the European Commission.
The answer to the State letter is under
drafting at the Agency/EC and will be
released by the European Commission.

IASFPWG - 18-19 May 2010 - London
IASFPWG - 18-19 May 2010 - London
page.enlisting:
The key for quality can only be to determine the adequate test methods The Agency plans to draft AMC applicable to Production Organisations and Maintenance organisations for guidance on how to perform the quality inspection of halon at incoming inspection The key for quality can only be to determine the adequate test methods
The key for quality can only be to
determine the adequate test methods
The Agency plans to draft AMC applicable to Production Organisations and Maintenance organisations for guidance on how to perform the quality inspection of halon at incoming inspection

to Production Organisations and
Maintenance organisations for guidance
on how to perform the quality inspection
of halon at incoming inspection
